intro: Carphalea pubiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered carphalea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
